definition: the spread of Korean cultural products (TV dramas, pop music etc) to other countries/Korean Wave
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: He reigns as the top Hallyu Star and often is described with numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他是頂級韓流明星，並且經常被人與數位連在一起。

sentences.english: The entire “Korean wave” is manufactured through subsidies and tax breaks.
sentences.chinese: 整個“韓流”是建立在政府補貼和賦稅減免的基礎上。

sentences.english: Recently many Hallyu stars fall in love. Also including you and HJM.
sentences.chinese: 最近很多韓流明星在熱戀，也有你的，說是韓智敏。

sentences.english: But some people disagreed with the Hallyu phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 不過，也有一些人對韓流現象表達了不滿。

sentences.english: So do you get any responsibility as a Hallyu star?
sentences.chinese: 作爲韓流明星你有什麼責任感嗎？

sentences.english: Hallyu star SSH announced the re-start of his acting activities.
sentences.chinese: 韓流明星宋承憲宣言表演活動再開始。

sentences.english: Do you always follow Korean Wave?
sentences.chinese: 你一直支持“韓流”的發展嗎？

sentences.english: Hallyu hanbok which he does through a dream.
sentences.chinese: 韓流韓服，他確實通過一個夢。

definition: lit. to catch everything in the one net (idiom)/fig. to scoop up the whole lot/to capture them all in one go
talkative/to blather/to shoot one's mouth off/rap (genre of music)
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
